awd_titl_txt: MRI: Development of Experiential Supercomputing: Developing a Transdisciplinary Research and Innovation Holodeck
awd_abstract_narration:
This project, developing a distributed instrument to physically integrate seamlessly the physical with the virtual, aims to create a unique experiential supercomputer, an immersive, collaborative, virtual/physical research environment with unparalleled tools for intellectual and creative output, a Holodeck that scientifically exceeds Star Trek science fiction. The work should advance the next-generation experiences in human interaction and deep integration of virtual and physical settings, creating rich actualizing environments to support research and discovery of new paradigms. The flexible, modular, reconfigurable infrastructure will connect researchers, research, and educational facilities across the university, the NYU Global Network University (GNU), and external researchers, communities, and industry partners worldwide. The instrument will enable exploration of a myriad of research questions involving virtual environments, telepresence, collaborative engagement, and remote interaction and create a strong foundation for extended collaborations. The project integrates qualitative and quantitative assessment of affect and motivation, with foundations of learning science, motion science, acoustics, modeling and simulation, robotics and fabrication to improve research effectiveness and scalability to address real world challenges.

The work is accomplished by integrating 3-D printing to physically realize simulated forms, robots to allow virtual models to impact the physical world and interact with it, haptics to provide to human collaborators a sense of tactile feel of virtual objects, and physiological state monitors to try to get "inside" the human experience. This "experiential supercomputing" serves as a paradigm for human collaboration that translates to all disciplines spanning computer science, engineering, music, psychology, nursing, radiology, applied math, biology, and medicine. The effort transcends visualization to approach human collaboration in its totality and has the potential to transform our fundamental understanding of collaboration, learning, creativity, discovery, and innovation. The NYU Holodeck will be a well-integrated software/hardware instrument incorporating visual, audio, and physical components and novel technologies to enhance social interactions (human-human, human-agent, and human-robot). In its incorporation of rapid prototyping and fabrication tools, this unique instrument fosters creative capacity, and tight coupling of interactive visual, audio, and physical experience. Its research capabilities support comprehensive capture of behavioral, physiological, affective, and cognitive data, and visualization and analysis of the data in real time. Creating innovative environments that bridge simulation, cyber learning, scientific visualization, human-computer interaction, and applied physical science research; the effort enables new types of science where researchers from diverse disciplines can interact with theoretical models, real objects, robots, and agents, engendering insights not possible using 2D, 3D, or other currently available representations.

NSF MRI 1626098: NYU Holodeck ? Project Outcomes Final Report 

Executive Summary

The National Science Foundation (NSF) Major Research Instrumentation (MRI) grant funding played a pivotal role in catalyzing the New York University (NYU) Holodeck project, a visionary initiative that aimed to help revolutionize the fields of immersive technology, education, research, and artistic expression. This final report provides an overview of the achievements and impacts of the NSF-funded NYU Holodeck project.

Introduction

The NYU Holodeck project goal was to explore and  to harness the transformative potential of immersive technologies, including virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR). Its goal was to create a cutting-edge platform for interdisciplinary collaboration, education, research, and scientific and artistic innovation. This report presents the culmination of our efforts and the profound impact in multiple domains.

Project Objectives

The NSF-funded NYU Holodeck project addressed several key objectives:

Immersive Technology Development: Develop state-of-the-art VR and AR environments to enable immersive experiences for education, research, and scientific and artistic expression.

Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Foster collaboration across diverse fields, bringing together researchers, educators, artists, and technologists to explore the rich potential of immersive technologies.

Educational Transformation: Integrate immersive technology into educational curricula to enhance learning outcomes and promote digital literacy.

Public Engagement: Extend the benefits of immersive technology to the broader public through exhibitions, outreach programs, and educational initiatives.

 

Achievements

1. Immersive Technology Development

The NYU Holodeck project achieved remarkable success in the development of immersive environments, setting new benchmarks for VR and AR applications. Application areas include educational simulations, interactive research projects, and groundbreaking performances. The shared, open source technical innovations in creating these immersive worlds has been a cornerstone of our achievements.

2. Interdisciplinary Collaboration

A hallmark of this project has been its ability to foster interdisciplinary collaboration. Researchers, educators, artists, and technologists from various academic backgrounds have come together to explore the limitless possibilities of immersive technologies. This convergence of diverse expertise has led to innovative projects that have expanded the boundaries of immersive technology applications.

3. Educational Transformation

The integration of immersive technology into educational curricula has been transformative. Immersive modules have been seamlessly incorporated into a wide range of courses on both the graduate and undergraduate levels, enabling students to explore subjects in new and dynamic ways. These innovations have resulted in higher student engagement, deeper comprehension of complex concepts, and improved knowledge retention.

4. Public Engagement

The NYU Holodeck project has successfully engaged the public through a series of exhibitions, outreach programs, and educational initiatives. These events have provided individuals of all ages with the opportunity to experience the potential impact of immersive environments. They have contributed to raising awareness and understanding of this emerging field and have sparked curiosity and interest in immersive technology.

Impact

The NSF MRI-funded NYU Holodeck project has had profound and far-reaching impacts:

Advancing Research: Researchers have leveraged the immersive Holodeck environments to conduct experiments and simulations, and to advance research across a wide spectrum of disciplines, including psychology, engineering, and computer science that were previously inconceivable.

Transforming Education: The integration of immersive technology into education has catalyzed a paradigm shift in the learning process. Students have reported increased engagement, deeper comprehension of complex subjects, and heightened enthusiasm for learning.

Fostering Creativity: Artists and creative professionals have embraced the Holodeck to push the boundaries of artistic expression. Concerts, immersive installations and interactive experiences have captivated audiences and pushed the frontiers of digital performance.

Engaging the Public: Concerts, presentations, and exhibitions have brought immersive technology to a broader audience, igniting interest in STEM fields, art, and technology.

Future Directions

The NSF-funded NYU Holodeck project has laid a strong foundation for continued innovation and exploration:

Research Expansion: Encourage ongoing interdisciplinary research in immersive technology, exploring its applications in fields such as medicine, architecture, and social sciences.

Education Integration: Further integrate immersive modules into educational curricula, extending their use both to K-12 and to other universities.

Artistic Innovation: Continue to support artists and creative professionals in exploring the artistic potential of immersive environments, thereby fostering the growth of digital performance.

Public Outreach: Sustain public engagement efforts through concerts, exhibitions, workshops, and open-source applications to ensure that immersive technology developed by the NYU Holodeck team remains accessible.

 

Conclusion

The NSF-funded NYU Holodeck project has not only met but exceeded its objectives, demonstrating the transformative power of immersive technology in education, research, performance, and public engagement. This project has ignited the imagination of students, educators, scientific researchers, creative artists and performers, and the general public.

In addition, we have built a powerful interdisciplinary network within NYU for building upon these successes and for doing further cutting edge research in immersive environments.

Moving forward, we are committed to building upon these successes, expanding our interdisciplinary collaborations, and continuing to explore the potential of immersive technology.
